Delicious and a great atmosphere! Had the Fire Drill cocktail that was so tasty. A few MUST HAVES: Starters and snacks - corn fritters, octopus and Jerusalem artichokes all amazing!! We had the Iberico pork and the cauliflower for mains that were both excellent. And then there was dessert.... milk and honey was SOOO GOOD as was the key lime pie. It took us 2 months to get a reservation at 18:00 on a Wednesday and by 20:00 they were definitely waiting to turn the table.  Definitely worth it.

I am completely in love with this place, and so happy that Viajante's replacement is such a standout. Nuno has done it again. 
Yup, it's in a former firehouse. This new space is warm and sexy and has a sense of place -- similar to Viajante. Now that it's less of a trek to get to, it seems to be a magnet for famous people. But you should go here because it is great and lovely. The ceiling looks like it is covered with the burlap strap woven bottoms of the seats of antique chairs. 
Sit at the "chef's table" (the bar) and watch the action at a 10+ foot long stove, custom made by some company in America. Getting that shipped out must have been quite an undertaking.
The cocktail list is incredible. I was waiting for my dining companion and enjoyed what I believe was called "love in a cold place" -- all of my favorite things in a glass. 
I'd had the Iberico pork steak at one of the Portuguese nights at Viajante, and it was great here, too. 
Sadly no frozen olive oil candies, but they do give you some chocolates to finish the meal.
Gluten-free notes: Many (half or more) of the dishes on the menu are gluten-free. They know what gluten is and can help you out. Unfortunately no freshly baked cumin rolls like Viajante had.

What can I say? This place is on another level. I love that it was a former firehouse, adds so much character! It is a trendy hotspot with incredible service and sensational food. Hands down one of my favourite dining experiences.
A friend couldn't make her dinner and gave us her booking and oh my goodness what a treat that was! The service was impeccable, the atmosphere was great and the food divine... Highly recommended

Very classy English style. Atmosphere and service splendid. Food also very tasty.
Out of the 4 dishes we ordered, only the rib is not very tasty, all others are awesome.

Everything about this restaurant exceeded expectations.  I was afraid it would be a tad over hyped and it wasn't.  We ate at the chef's counter because we were not able to get a reservation for a regular table and I am glad we had this experience which allowed us to watch the chefs in action.  The atmosphere is great and the service is impeccable, friendly, and unpretentious.  The food was outstanding as well.  The zucchini starter, the crab donuts, the caesar salad, the pumpkin gnocchi, and the chicken were all delicious.  These are very talented chefs, serving quality food with very fresh ingredients in an unpretentious setting.  We even purchased the cookbook and attempted to make a reservation for the next evening (unfortunately they were booked solid, but I can see why)  This isn't one of those places that makes it difficult to get a reservation to appear desirable... the food is that good and the reservation dept will do their best to accommodate you.  Next time our travels take us to London I am making sure to make at least one reservation at this restaurant.  I live in New York City and I have never had service this welcoming and accommodating at any restaurant.  When we were leaving they called a cab for us and held an umbrella over my fiance as we walked out of the building.  These small gestures all helped make a great experience.

It was our second last night in London and we were looking for chic London cuisine-Both Foursquare and Yelp pointed us towards The Chilton Firehouse.  After zigzagging through the streets for quite a while we finally found it.  Speaking to the Maitre d' we were lucky enough to secure two seats at the chef's table. We were greeted very warmly by Rafal who would be our server for the evening.  We started out with a wonderful full bodied Italian red. The first course chosen was the crab stuffed donuts which proved to be light and delicious.  The second course chosen was the pumpkin porridge-truly fantastic with hazelnuts and chestnuts on top.  Perfect balance! Growing up eating wild game my father hunted I was thrilled to find venison on the menu which was enthusiastically encouraged by Rafal. It was such a pleasure to watch the hustle of the kitchen as everyone worked fluidly to create some exquisite looking plates-every dish was tended to like a work of art! The venison(ordered medium rare) did not disappoint! Smoky, juicy and balanced out with a pecan pesto and a teriyaki-glazed chard. Every bite was beyond delectable! After asking us a few questions, Rafal suggested the frozen apple pannacotta for dessert and it couldn't have been more perfect! Rafal's charm and wit made our experience incredibly enjoyable. As the meal came to a close Rafal brought a picture perfect cappuccino that tasted as perfect as it looked. Shifting to the bar for a nice after dinner drink-a special Zacapa rum was chosen. The bartenders were equally wonderful, charming and a joy to watch as they mixed endless cocktails with precision and ease. Our experience will be talked about for a very long time! THANK YOU!

This was one of the best meals I have had in recent memory. The atmosphere is fantastic, the crowd of beautiful people is nice, the service is warm and excellent... But to top all that off with this menu and the mind blowing execution of our orders? Just wow. This is a new place and I am sure the magic can't last. Does it ever? But cheers to one of the best recent restaurant experiences I've had not only in London, but in my two home towns New York and Los Angeles as well.
This review is for the lounge - just lovely. My favourite place to dance into the early hours.

The Chiltern Firehouse is possibly my favorite restaurant and club in all of London. The interior is warm and provides various nooks for private conversations. The entire building and patio are meticulously maintained.

Went for dinner on Saturday night. Atmosphere was lovely. I'd go again just for that. Service was also good and very friendly. They told us we had to be finished in 2 1/2 hours which was a pity because we would have stayed on and had desert and more drinks. I'm not a fan of restaurants that move you out, especially if you're spending big as we were. Cocktails were very nice. Starters of crab donuts and octopus were excellent but main courses were just ok. Maple sweet potato mash was the consistency of baby food and far too sweet. Could only taste maple. Sadly, all the food was totally over salted. The whole table said so. Apart from the crab donuts (which were gorgeous), octopus and maple mash everything, without exception was salty and this is coming from people who love highly-seasoned food. Still, service and atmos was good enough that we'll be back. Also, it's a shame they save the pretty courtyard as a "sacred space" for hotel guests. It remained more or less completely empty whereas we could have been continuing our evening and spending money!

Very discreet from the street; inside extremely classy and elegant. I adored the hallways and bar area was simply beautiful. I had booked a table for my daughter & myself, the staff were wonderfully accommodating with her, fixing posh juices, shaking her hand giving her a super cute little dessert! Our waiter from Spain (Pierre?) was a stand out as was the bar tender in the main bar area. Would have given 5* alas there was no soup on the menu, which on a freezing day - we were craving!!

Really good food. Nice range of dishes from the quite simple to the complex... There is also a good price range to cater for people on different budgets. The staff were also very polite and knowledgeable.

If you follow any celeb press you will know this is THE place to be in London.  Not sure why it has such a following and not sure why the paparazzi didn't photograph me, but oh well.
The place is very pretty and if you can get near the seats by the kitchen that looks to be fun.  The space is very pretty although lacks soul and the women all walk around in these monochrome brightly colored jumpsuits that look like they are from Star Trek.  Bizarre.
For those that had been to Viajante, expect something very different--whereas Viajante was very creative, experimental and playful--this is much more subtle, orchestrated and refined.  Crab donuts, octopus appetizer, the pork and fish dishes were all very good.  No complaints.  But I wasn't wowed over either.
With all the celeb buzz good luck getting in, but sit back and enjoy if you do.

This place is spectacular! I love that they converted this place into a restaurant-super cool. Sadly, they were too packed to seat us for dinner, but we sat by the bar for cocktails and light appetizers. The cocktails were delightful! The apps were very nice too. Next time I am here I will definitely try dinner too!

Loved the ambiance and trendy feeling
Got a 9,30pm thru a VIP friend and had a good time. We loved the trendy and casual chic ambiance and the food was pretty good too. We only ordered a bunch of small plates and the bacon maple cornbread was the best! Also the chicken bites and the gnocchi. The famous crab doughnuts were nothing special though, Quite bland actually! But above all I liked getting to know what all the hype was about --and it was fun.
Visited October 2015
London's current hotspot that shows no sign of slowing down anytime soon. Great scene, amazing bartenders and phenomenal cocktails. Makes for a lively (and highly amusing evening out)
We had the snug room, the food was amazing , the staff are excellent and the drink menu and wine list is brilliant .

It's a fun place to visit.  We celebrated my partner's sister's BD there, and we had a fantastic time.  Food was not so memorable, but drink was incredible.  After we enjoyed champaign by the glass, our sommelier did a great job recommending a beautiful bottle of Burgundy Pinot Noir.  Dessert wine was also great.  Service was excellent.  Servers were amazingly attentive for such a packed restaurant.  I will be happy to go back.
Amazing place - old fire-house converted to restaurant. Great ambiance, amazing service and the most wonderful brunch. Not the cheapest but definitely worth every penny

Great service, amazing atmosphere and very creative dishes. I ordered almost everything on the menu, loved the appetizers, entrees (main) was good; but I recommend just ordering a whole bunch of appetizers and maybe one main. Our waiter was super friendly, even took us on a tour around the kitchen. PS go check out the secret hidden smoking area. Pretty bad a$$!

Came here for birthday drinks with one of my best friends. The decor of the horseshoe shaped bar is beautiful. Even though our servers took ages to bring our drinks, they were so sweet, I couldn't get upset (and I could because it was my birthday). Also there was a bulldog and puppy circling around and guests were surprisingly sweet and responsive towards the adorable animals. All in all, great experience.

This review is for the hotel. Seriously, impeccable service. They somehow know your name from the second you arrive and go out of their way to make you feel taken care of. Oh, and the bedrooms have fireplaces.

Wow! Beautiful place, food, people, ambiance, service!  One of the best restaurants I've ever been to hands down. Our server, Joanna was fabulous. Great recommendations, very knowledgable about menu items. We started with cornbread made with bacon grease served with a chipotle butter. Also has two bottles of excellent New Zealand sauvegnon blanc. Our appetizers were grilled octopus, oysters and burrata cheese. Everything was amazing. The seasonings really come out in the flavor, unbelievable. For entrees, I had the monkfish, daughter had halibut and husband and other daughter had the pork. All dishes were works of art and simply incredible. Our desserts also were to die for. We shared a key lime pie, a chocolate fish and a mandarin sorbet. We got a tour of hotel and rooms after dinner which was lovely. Great bar and intimate feel, highly recommend this place!

Very lovely restaurant with a classy and well mannered crowd. Food modern and delicious and not as outrageously expensive as you would imagine. Entire feel of the place reminded me of an upmarket Californian restaurant.Particularly stunning gardens and entryway. Not quite as exclusive as it was last year so a little easier to book a reservation and can often stroll up just to use the restaurant's bar.

First things first. Everyone has a beard here. The doorman. The waiter. Chefs. The other wAiter. And not your designer stubble either. These are PROPER beards. This is a very style conscious place. But regardless, the food was great. Best bits though were the sides, the starters and the desserts. The latter were especially creative not least the key lime pie and the apple panaccota. As for the sides, try the fried chicken and crab doughnuts. The mains were solid but nothing out of the ordinary. The exception was the fillet steak, wonderful smoky flavour and so tender.

All that glitters is not gold. The disparity between the hype and the reality of the Chiltern firehouse was so extreme it needed calling out.
This is a beautiful location and it's buzzing, but once inside it felt like you were part of a machine designed to get you in and out, and onto the next guest.
Above all, it was the lack of consistency in terms of food and service that was astounding.
Too fast to take orders & way too slow to deliver them. Food was brought to the table out of sequence. Insipid cocktails, staff with a lack of basic knowledge on the drinks / food offering. The signature dish, 'Pork Iberico', was tough & dry and, worst of all, the 'maple sweet potato' side dish was so sweet it was inedible.
The whole operation appeared almost random, apparently lacking an authoritative maitre d' to ensure it flowed professionally.
There were several highlights, including some of the food dishes (Carrot blunts, Short rib, Octopus), but way too few to warrant the price and the reputation, especially when London has so many other great restaurants.
The one saving grace was our main server, who was excellent -  she was the only redemption for a venue that has built a reputation for being coolest eatery in town, yet completely lacked the attention to detail to deserve that accolade.
Fun and charming place with great food. A fun night out in London if you like  a casual place, great food and a good wine list.

Thank you so much for making my husband's 50th Birthday even more special!  I wanted to thank everyone at Chiltern Firehouse for the fabulous meal and experience while we were in London.  I especially want to thank the bartender who crafted a beautiful handmade cocktail especially for my husband and delivered it to our table with a message from our sons who could not be with us.  The restaurant and bar were packed, so I truly appreciate his efforts and my husband was blown away by the whole thing. Again, thank you for the lovely atmosphere, the outstanding food, the interesting crowd and a very special thank you to the bartender!!!!

Sad to say that the hype may have gotten the best of this restaurant.
The small bites, appetizers and desserts were all fantastic. Well prepared and presented. The main courses we ok, but nothing spectacular. No real complaints, just nothing to write home about. While the restaurant has an excellent wine list, it is grotesquely overpriced. It's aimed towards those who want to be seen spending money, not those interested in drinking a great wine.
Our main waiter was very friendly. However, there seems to be overall poor communication between the staff. We would ask for a drink or bread and the message never seemed to be passed on - disappointing for a restaurant of this calibre. Having to re-ask for things multiple times is tiresome. The sommelier also left something to be desire as far as friendliness goes.
The atmosphere and décor are lovely and comfortable. Modern European with an open kitchen.
If you're prepared for the fact that it's over-hyped, you'll have a good dinner.

I loved my experience at Chiltern Firehouse. Although it was very difficult to get a reservation it was worth it. The caesar salad was excellent. My fish dish was flakey and moist inside and crisp on the outside. The service was perfect and I will make a reservation long before I travel to London to go back again!

Best Eggs Benedict I have ever had. There was a little snobbiness when I asked for a side of potatoes but I quickly got over it as the food was delicious and we were able to get it without a reservation. Yum. Ambience was fabulous too!

The decor is super and our waiter was fabulous, however, when the starter came wrong and we complained the manger Jonathan arrived who had the wrong attitude. He was more keen to prove us wrong than correct the mistake. We booked a table for 5, a few weeks ago but were given a table for 4 with a seat in the passage for the 5th. Don't be excited to visit as they overbook and have arrogance.
I think once the popularity wears out this place will be a disaster as needs to pay attention to the customer.

The most pretentious place I have ever eaten at. You can read all the other reviews about the decor and the setting which is quite spectacular. The place is a scene to be seen and for those to see you. From the moment you arrive you are greeted by the outside bellman/bouncers? and looked up and down before you are delivered off to another chap who walks you thorough the maze to the hostess. 
Picture this, we went for breakfast on a Monday morning with four people and there was only a handful of tables occupied with about 25 staff people milling around trying to look busy. It was amazing the number of staff present for Monday morning breakfast.
We place our order for breakfast, with only one request, that one of the egg dishes be cooked well done. (no running yokes) Simple enough for any breakfast cook.
When the dish arrived, the yoke was still runny and we asked if we could get the order done as requested. The look and attitude that we received from the waitress was " I told them to cook it the way you wanted". It went back to the kitchen and was recooked.
Then I took a bite of my french toast, it was totally raw inside, with the milk and egg oozing out. I asked another waitress if the chef could finish cooking the french toast and she brought the dish back to the kitchen.
About 5 minutes later our waitress delivered us the following message from the Chef. " I will be happy to cook you another french toast, but it will come out the same way as before" OMG Any five year old can cook french toast!  I was ready to get up and go in the kitchen and show the chef how to make the simplest of breakfast foods.
It just wasn't worth the effort. 
I guess the celebs like their food un cooked. This place is not worth the time nor the effort, especially when there is such a big disconnect between the kitchen, staff and guest.
They obviously did not recognize who we were......
but I hope for all you reading this, you don't support such an unwelcoming place that can't train its staff and kitchen about basic customer service, considering they have so many people on duty.

A place you come just to be seen.  I was seen and I saw.  The food which was dinner was good.  I love snobby atmospheres, and we got into the lounge after which was fun. Dinner was nothing to write home about but then again I don't write much.

If I have to be honest, I have traveled extensively and you certainly get the feeling here that if your not a famous face your not worth much. We had a meeting in the less that par conference room and we're constantly harassed by the staff after hours as to wether or not we were staying at the hotel or not. For the over all price I do not see the value

This place is the worst.  The crowd is old and wannabe.  Not contemporary or for the young, successful,  and attractive at ALL. The people there did not look good.
   This place claims to be elite but probably was 2 years ago.  We had dinner there and the food was tasteless and very average.  On top of that, they said we could get to the main bar area, and after having us spend so much money on crappy food, they did not let us in to the main bar, claiming they were at "full capacity".  Then when trying to leave, they tried to be "gracious" by hailing us a taxi out of a strange back ally.  The taxi, we realized while already on the road, was cash only, and took us on a completely round about route, which cost twice as much as any taxi we had taken for the same distance.  When we confronted the taxi driver, threatening to report him,  he gave us a discount.  
    All and all, we had a terrible and expensive experience being ripped off at the Chiltern Firehouse.  Don't believe the hype. Just don't go here.

Had an amazing dinner saturday night at Chiltern. The full review is on my blog with loads of pictures. Usually the hottest places don't deliver on either food or service, here they deliver on everything. The food was creative and fun, the service was happy and it was as buzzy as it gets.

Excellent food. Great service but rushed a little at first. Interesting desserts. Sort of loud but in a good environment. Chocolate ice cream was strong but good. We had  very positive experience. A great way to end our London trip.

I loved the decor and food but no where in all my travels, and there have been many, did a waiter as us to hurry it along.  Mind you, this is an expensive lunch, we certainly didn't linger long.  I guess his huff when we didn't order the moment he set the wine down should have been a clue.
